info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 600 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sugarite, or near Raton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton, Sugarite and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 451 and 458. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 350 and 357. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
